answers.answer: I just posted the same question..It feels like warm water draining inside your head..Mine is on the right side..I have no insurance either..so hopefully someone will respond and I can let you know...Or if I do get an MRI...I can let you know what a Dr. says

Hi KS,Feeling of tingling, burning, creepy or crawly feeling, suggest paresthesias. Any type of tingling, burning, or numbness is usually a symptom related to a sensory nerve being damaged, diseased, or injured. The area you are talking about is called C2-C3 dermatome. Usually it is physical injury to nerve like any nerve compression or direct pressure being applied to nerve, which causes these symptoms.Similar symptoms are common with patients of long standing Diabetes.If any of these symptoms are increasing and annoying, then you need to see a doctor, probably a neurologist to rule out any pathological state.

question: Hi, for about 2 months now I have been experiencing a tingling sensation on the left side of my scelp.  It only happens a few times a day and for a short period of time.  I have no other symptoms and some times I don't have it for a day or two.  There are times when I feel it that it sends a chill throughout my entire body.  Any answers as to what might be causing this?  I haven't been to a Dr., I don't have any insurance, but if this might be serious then I need to know.  Thanks
title: tingling sensation on left side of scelp
